title: Moto9999
author: Moto9999
content: I came across a post on reddit that said satoshi Nakamoto made a board game and put private keys of early bitcoin addresses in it then published it could such a thing be possible let me know your thoughts

comments.author: noorman0
comments.body: Afaik, the only account to interact with the community was on this forum at the time. But so far I haven't found a statement that Satoshi has ever created a particular game that specifically involves private keys.I'm sure it was just created by someone else going by the name satoshi. Without the reference to the game you are referring to, my first guess is that it's a scam game.

comments.author: logfiles
comments.body: Go back to that Reddit post and share the link here. Satoshi never talked about anything to do with inventing a board game. The problem is probably you're believing anything you see on the internet. There are so many fraudsters out there who try as much as possible to use Satoshi's name when promoting their projects because they know that some noobs with jump into the wagon just because they mentioned satoshi.

comments.author: Rupok
comments.body: Every online based board game is using the term Satoshi.  Using Satoshi's name, they want to promote their game boards.But does Satoshi have anything to do with game innovation?  Game developers are using this word satoshi to promote and promote their games.Satoshi's name appears on every online platform and involve is cheating.Our problem is that we are becoming addicted to games without reference.  These games are usually created by scammers and use these words to trick others.  We should be wary of these game boards.

comments.author: Odusko
comments.body: I am not aware of such a game developed by Satoshi, but the question is if that is possible what is the wallet amount of those private keys embedded in the game?If this is possible which I think is not, it will be the most suit after the game is made public, can you please share a link to the Reddit post was this information originated from to find more information?

comments.author: Moto9999
comments.body: Its a post from reddit https://ibb.co/DVsn7s4 https://ibb.co/25Hd7jF you can check it out let me know what you think I think there might be some truth to it the private keys hidden in the game contain satoshis earliest btc wallet the ones that had  a lot of btc in it

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: Quote from: Moto9999 on March 18, 2023, 03:32:19 PMIts a post from reddit https://ibb.co/DVsn7s4 https://ibb.co/25Hd7jF you can check it out let me know what you think I think there might be some truth to it the private keys hidden in the game contain satoshis earliest btc wallet the ones that had  a lot of btc in itLol. It sounds like a movie plot. No way Satoshi would place those private keys on an obscure board game knowing someone could masquerade as him/her with those on their hand. and no mention of this was made either. Remember, private keys = ownership.To add on, I skimmed at their previous posts and they're into conspiracy theories. No reason to believe this.
